I'm Wally the post officer.
I am working here at the post office for Kevin.
Oh, our boss is upstairs. Better only disturb him with important issues though.
Oh, our boss is upstairs. Better only disturb him with important issues though.
We are an organization of importance for the whole of Tibia. Even kings tremble before our might.
You have to talk with the exalted archpostman Kevin Postner if you want to join our prestigeous guild.
This minotaur is quite moody. Better make sure not to anger him. He's likely to call for his guards as soon as he notices a stranger, so you are on tough luck if you ever find him.
This old whitebeard lives on some hill on the western coast of Vega as far as I know.
This guy might be hard to find. Hes likely disguising himself. If you see someone suspicious, try to ask other people who are around about him. That might give you some clue.
Ask Mr. Postner about your current missions.
Old Ben lost some of his marbles in some battle long ago. He is still a quite capable postman though ... on second thought thats some disturbing fact.
Dwarfs make quite good postmen. They are stubborn, strong and ... sturdy. Its a waste that he prefers a job behind the counter.
Dove is as good as a dozend pigeons. He He He.

This Olrik was made postman only for convenience. He is quite aware that his attitude and affiliation with the thaian government makes it impossible for him to rise in rank. This leads only to him behaving even worse tough.
Although I never met her in person we became penpals over the time.
Yes, thats me, Wally!
The exalted archpostman Kevin Postner alone decides about advancement of our members. All ranks come with certain privileges.
Our privileges are top secret, other people envy us enough already for beeing members in this splendid guild.
I vaguely remember the last dress pattern of our uniforms was dependend on certain key elements. It had some technical gadgets, a special smell and was uniquely colored.
Most general stores should sell crowbars. I think the store in Edron sells some for instance.
I can't help you much with your missions. Of course we tell you everything we know and do't make our missions needlesly difficult.
Its humble and practical. Considering we have bases all over the known world we don't need a bigger base anyways. On the other hand Mr. Postner is dreaming about a postman academy now and then.
If I would be looking for bones I'd inspect some skeletons ... If I weren't so affraid of them that is.
Uh? How disgusting. Look for this rubbish in some places where waste is dumped .. and don't ever tell me what you need it for.
As far as I heard some of the minor orcs carry a pice of fur as a fetish or lucky charm with them.
What a disgusting taste you have. Like those Goblins who carry this stuff with them.
This dog is his majestys most priced possesion and heavily guarded. Anger the dog and you anger the king.
One of the oldest holdings of humanity that still exist and the heart of the biggest kingdom in the known world.
Carlin is an upcoming power in theese days. Albeit its ambitions it still dwarfs the old kingdom of thais in power and influence.
I think no longer is king Tibianus reigning this city, nor are the merchants ruling it, regardless what they might think. The true monarch before whom all there bow is the money.
I gues Edron isn't the source of wealth and rescources as the thaians hoped. The defection of those knights did cause the expansion and exploitation there to an halt.
I know nothing special about that story. I only heared that a good part of the knightly order the king sent there succumbed to their lust for wealth and power and turned against their swordbrethren.
A far away place with strange customs and an even stranger philosophy. One day I might travel there to see it on my own.
